meanings.definition: Start or restart a computer or electronic device by loading the operating system again.
meanings.sent1: After the crash, I had to reboot my computer to make it work again.
meanings.sent2: She rebooted her phone to fix the software glitch.
meanings.sent3: The robot kept rebooting itself, thinking it was a fun game.
meanings.sent4: His mind felt like it was rebooting after a good night's sleep.
meanings.sent5: The power outage caused the system to reboot, erasing all unsaved data.

meanings.definition: Give new energy or strength to something.
meanings.sent1: A short break can help reboot your focus and productivity.
meanings.sent2: Exercise and fresh air can reboot your mood and motivation.
meanings.sent3: The superhero's special drink could instantly reboot his powers.
meanings.sent4: Her encouraging words acted like a reboot for his confidence.
meanings.sent5: The sunrise over the mountains seemed to reboot the whole landscape with vibrant colors.
